case_vignette: A 57-year-old man presents with a large wound on his right lower leg that has been present for 6 months as shown in the picture. He has had chronically swollen legs for over 10 years. His mother and brother had similar problems with their legs. He had a documented deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in the affected leg 5 years earlier, but has no other past medical history. He has a blood pressure of 126/84 and heart rate of 62/min.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a big sore on my right lower leg that hasn't healed for 6 months, and my legs have been swollen for over 10 years.
Have you noticed any changes in skin color or temperature in your legs?
I'm just here to discuss the large wound on my leg, and I didn't mention anything about skin color or temperature changes.
Understood. Have you been diagnosed with diabetes, peripheral artery disease, or any other chronic conditions?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with diabetes, peripheral artery disease, or any other chronic conditions, aside from that clot I had in my leg 5 years ago.
Do you currently have any pain in your leg or in the wound itself?
You didn't ask me about pain, so I didn't mention if I'm experiencing any.
Did the sore on your leg start as a smaller wound or injury that has worsened over time?
The vignette doesn't specify how the sore on my leg started, so I can't say if it began as a smaller wound or injury.
Is the sore on your leg deep or superficial, and is there any discharge from the sore?
The vignette doesn't provide details on the depth of the sore or any discharge, so I can't provide that information.
Do you have any history of varicose veins or a family history of chronic venous insufficiency?
My mother and brother had similar leg problems, which might indicate a family history related to vein issues.
Considering the chronic nature of your swelling, the non-healing wound, and a family history of venous problems, is the wound located near your ankle?
The vignette doesn't specify the exact location of the wound on my leg, other than it being on the lower part.
Have you experienced any recent trauma to your leg where the sore is present?
No, I haven't had any recent trauma to my leg.
Have you been taking any medications or treatments for the leg swelling or the sore on your leg?
The vignette doesn't mention any medications or treatments that I've been taking.

Based on the chronic leg swelling for over 10 years, the family history of venous problems, and a non-healing sore on the lower leg, alongside a history of a clot in the leg:

**Final Diagnosis:** Venous stasis ulcer.
